title: Petrobangla, BUET pledge collaboration
body: A memorandum of understanding was signed between Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corporation (Petrobangla) and Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology at the Petrobangla office in Dhaka to strengthen collaborative initiatives in education, research, and training. The signing ceremony was graced by the vice-chancellor of BUET, Professor Abu Borhan Mohammad Badruzzaman and the chairman of Petrobangla, Md Rezanur Rahman. The MoU was signed by senior general manager of Petrobangla Secretary Md Amzad Hossain and by BUET Research and Innovation Centre for Science and Engineering (RISE) director Professor Mohammad Shariful Islam. BUET`s deputy director (RISE) as well as directors and senior officials of Petrobangla were also present at the ceremony. This MoU is expected to accelerate research activities through enhanced information exchange between Petrobangla and the faculty and students of BUET. Such collaboration will play a significant role in meeting future industry needs. In addition, the MoU will support the professional skill development of personnel, facilitate joint research initiatives, and promote knowledge enhancement through meetings, seminars, and workshops. The MoU will remain effective for five years from the date of signing and may be renewed automatically for an additional five-year term. This MoU is expected to further strengthen research collaboration and foster a deeper, long-term partnership between Petrobangla and BUET.
